chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A Krivitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 34 days was granted, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zachary A Krivitz in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Court conducts colloquy with Defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to County #1. Court finds the Defendant guilty of count #1. FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED RE: VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.

State makes sentencing recommendations. Atty Wolff makes sentencing recommendations. The Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.
34 days credit IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation: 12 MONTHS
CONCURRENT TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $268.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE: $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation..
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

File not called on the record.
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Peter M Wolff in court, defendant Zachary A Krivitz not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Wolff waives his client's appearance.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date next week.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
